S.FORM: kai vaiyana mo tatakesikesiyako ki ’ito ka toki ki miyalrealre.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: la ai kicakwanganai, sa modaane ko sinsinai ki takibolrobolrowa, ko pangcan kai taberanai la aminiya kawriva “’idiya! songalra!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: la akwadrawnai makanaelre sinsi “mwadringadringaiso amiya kawariva.
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: sa kicakwakwa nai, ko sinsinai la ’elaela naiya sinTaromakana wasi’i.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Rukai language of numbers.

S.FORM: la to’a’arlanai wasi’i, ko sinsinai la ’elaela naiya ‘asenaya ki ’wasi’i.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: makalra kai kicekwaneli si la wathingalenganako sin Taromakana.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Rukai languages.

S.FORM: watwakesi yako tothadalrane, wakicakwako ki kwacalrilrisiyana tothadalrane, ai ’akilalrako ki tinali.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Rukai language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: siya Kelesai ko naganeli.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Kelesai。
My name is Kelesai.

S.FORM: siya Gaita ko nagane ki tamali.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Gaita。
My dad’s name is Gaita.

S.FORM: siya Dolray ko nagane ki tinali.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Dolray。
My mother’s name is Dolray.

S.FORM: kaiyasa tara mangealenga kai caylili.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: yakai ka tangea ka takali ka sawalay, siya Masegesege kai naganeini,tara mangealenga si eea kai cayli ini.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Masegesege，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Masegesege, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: yakai nai tayangea ki tatakesikesiya twakesi.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: konako si takali ka sawalay madalame nai senay.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: madalamako langoy,lo taisadrasadraza maelrelre nai ka cekecekele mwa langolangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: madalamako mathingathingale ki bawva ka talragi, la kalekete nai maelrelre senasenay si lwangolwangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: lalakako ki so Taromake.
S.TRANSL: 我是魯凱族的小孩。
I am an Taromake child.

S.FORM: ko daane nai yakai Taromake.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在達魯瑪克。
Our family lives in Taromake.

S.FORM: talima nai ka cekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tatolro nai ka lamatakataka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: konako si tama, tina, taka ka sawalay si taka ka ababay maelrelre nai.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ko tamali ka mabelreng, kensase ko tamali.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: marilay ko tinali, ko tinali ka ’ising.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: lo ikai daane ko tamali wa soTaromakana makawrivariva naiya.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Rukai language with us at home.

S.FORM: lo taisadrasadra ki kaladraidraza wa mobaliyo nai cekele.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: konako si latakali maelrelre nai mwa walra ina takolariyase.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: madalamako ki cekecekeleli.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: kai vaiya maelrelre ko ki tinali mwa kivaevang.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: kai vaiyana masalese kai sobelebeleng, kadro makecelre kadro drangedrang, mangangerece kai sasevere.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: yakai nai ki tasiobola twakainene si kanekane mingpaw, kai vai ’asaelre ki kinaomasa nai masolra’ele ’aramoro.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: sa miyaobonga, madirele kai sobelebeleng.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: la ki’elaelako ki tinali, asi madirerele kai sobelebeleng?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: ko tinali kawriva laiya, ai kela kai masasevesevere.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: kai amaong kadrowa ka emeeme sobelebeleng, mwtalrivaivainga tariyaw.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: ai mobaliyo nai.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: ikai kaelrea mobaliyo, sidramadramako ki tariyaw,
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: anatoma la nikai kela kai masasevesevere, angielra kivaevang kidremedremeli.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: kai tatakesikesiyanai yakai thili ki naiyana, tothadalranako dadavace mwa tatakesikesiya, miya dadavace mobaliyo.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: kai tatakesikesiyanai kadro madraw, kadrowa ka takakalra ka takesikesi, mathingathingale nai makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: konai ka lavavalake mokasa nai ikai ki dradralraza, la maelrelrenai angimalimali, si makawrivariva si masososo.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: ko lasinsi miya kiaelre naiya kivaevaevang, takamiya nai ka wacekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: tothadalranai swaswa’e, nikabola ki takibolrobolrowa nai amiyanai makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: yakai ka tabere mwa mosakisakidri lribang, si kwadra ladroma ka tabere mwa swaswaswa’e daeda’e.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: wa swaswa’e nai asaelre ki laro’osonga ki tatakesikesiyanai, wa karathodo nai si mavalavala ina atomana, la kadelese tothadalrane kai tatakesikesiyanai.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: koza, mobaliyo nai ki cekelenai mwa ’olridraw ki tomoli.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: mawlainga kanai maceceele ki tomoli, mabarengerako ki tomoli.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: sa ceele nakowa ki tomoli, ko tomoli ’asadalro nakwa ’oakane seika si ’wcia.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: malrimeme kai seika ki ’odroli ki tomoli, atengatenga mwadringai aramoro.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: miya madalamako kai ’wcia ki tomoli, miya ka mwadringai.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: lo kodralridralriya, maelrelrako si kaingoli twaga kodralri.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: ko kaingoli twaga kodralri taleke, yakai sa kaang, tarokoko, taramonage si dingding.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: sa maka tokodralri, amwanai lacaceng ki laceng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: ko kaingoli mala madromolro ka birasi, tay si rakiyo bay nakowa, amala iloko mobaliyo.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: si aokiyovagai lriniya, si mawriva ko bilrilanenga naw kela ’olridraw lriniya.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: kai vaiyana ko sinsi iloko naiya mwa tala’ola’owa ki lagolagolay, yalangai nai sa kipo la tilribi nai ikai ki sawlatadra.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: sa modaanenga nai, ko sinsi laelraela naiya, “kai cocobonga ka lazazame, kai lrikodranga ka laolawlay, angikamaniyata ceele si siyavava.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mwakolodrako ki olawlay, amanisa nako kiyaomaw mwa ceele laolawlay.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: waceelako makalra azazame, yabeleng ki angato aniya’ala’alay, si waceelako loo yakai barongolo ’adring ki angato wa’e’ece.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: kai tala’ola’owa ki golagolay yakai ka zoo, baa si lrikolaw, nakowaceelana kai lagolagolay saiyana, kai vaiyana waceelanganako matiyakiraragai kidremedrameli.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: la sasiyasingako makalra ka sasing, ai bwaiyako ’aceele ki marodrawdrang.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: lo abilrilinga ai maelrelreako si marodraodrang anivalre kela.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: kai taisadrasadra nai, tadrosa nai ka takali ka ababay si konako mwlrika’e ki agi ki tamali ikai Balangaw.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: mwbeleng kisiya nai twalai Taipake na kala Balrangaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: sa kelanganai Balrangaw, ko agi ki tamali ango sidosiya si kela kisiya kidreseng naiya.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來火車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: kadro wadayli kodaana ki gai ki tamali, ’lo angota sidosiya ’adalro wakelata.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: kodaana ki agi ki tamali sa’agiyagisi yakai ka madraw ka tala’ola’owa ki golagolay, ango ’aliliding nai mwa tala’ola’owa ki golagolay.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: ikainai iniya, ko agi ki tamali iloko naiya walomo bo’a’e si mobeleng ki baa.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: sa amaong, maelrelrenai mwa maci kwane sa aga.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: lo ikai maci makalra ka sidosiya, amanisa ango nai ’otobay mwa kawai.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: sa amwadadavace nai, la kidringai ’otobaiyanai ki’akotrakilinga, la mobelengnai baase si davace mobaliyo.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: wa mobaliyonganai kela Taipake kaiyasa, kadro thingale idra kidringainga ’otobay ki agi ki tamali amiyanai kidremedreme.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: sa lrolraina naiya takaikaiya so Taromake, si atwanaw takesiyana, lra mwsali Taicyo, tara ikai maci tacekecekelra.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在達魯瑪克，上學以後，就搬到了台中，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Taromake. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: na kelanga taikake, watakesiako eea ka takesi idra kakoza ki kacelisiya, athingale nakowa makaelraela kakoza ki kacalisiya so Taivang.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: amanisa, taisadrasadraza ki kaladraidraza, konako si takali ka sawalay mwbaliyowa cekeleli kielraelra lramarodrang, anatoma si alrecega yataka cekele kakozaneta.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: tara mavalolronga ka cayli ini kai marodrang, eene loceele takamaiya yacengeceng.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: lamani ko kielraelra idra wathingale taiya ka vagana, kali’ace ini sing Taromakana, miya maligilri swa Songaw, swa Talalibeka, swa Di’ong.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的東魯凱語說得很流利，也會說布農語、卑南語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Taromak, as well as Bunun, Pinuyumayan and Japanese.

S.FORM: la kielraelrako kwani na akithingale nakowa, si sa lrolrainga wakicakwa ini vaga ki swa Di’ong, ko sakacekele ini ka swa Songaw, mathingathingale takalra swa Talalibeka ikai tatwlavalavaza ini, amanisa malalekete kawriva makalra ka makaelraelra vagana.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多卑南族人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Pinuyumayan at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: lo tamasososo sakibolobolo nai,ko marodrang elraelraelra makalra kwadra sininadroma lrigila ki alro’o.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: eene odrava lo kadrowa makathingale kidremedreme nai, la ni arakaiya nai ki soci rako’ing, lai kalalekete nai kilalra twadriyadringai.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: sa lrolrainganako nako thingale kakoza ki cekeleta, maininoako ki sw kwacalisiya.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: sa wathingale arokakalra, lo kidremedremeli sw Taromakako ka nikalrivala, miya ka anikamiya.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為東魯凱族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Taromak is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: lo amiyaobo, ai mwbaliyo ko agili ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: konako si kaingoli amwa nai maci langai sa tarokoko, adolro kwaobo ka mwadringai akane ki agili ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: sa lribate nai talacenga, ikai talacenga yakai ka makala ka ngetangeta ka laceng.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: walangai nai sa ’incai, bakway si ningiging.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: kwani tawki ka thilri tiyang ka kilrangai sa madro mawriva matikaikay amiya, “malrimeme kai angodraleli si vinwate obawbala. lwangai’a kobekela!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: la langai nai angodrale si vinwate obawbala.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: sa lribate nai kai tiyang ka kilrangai sa botolo, la mawriva tawki matikay, “ai langai sa manema? kaivaiyana madraw si karocolo kai tarokoko, tolro ka idai ka ’aiso ka eea.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: lo miniya ka makocingalre aramoro kidremedreme ki kaingoli, si kielraelra tawki kalekete ma’adolro kobekela.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: la kwani tawki tobale nai amiya ma’adodolronga, kai kalekete ’oda’eda’e ’aiso laiya.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kodra yathili ka tawki la dawdawdaw, nyama lwangai’a kaangeli, madraw si ma’adolro laiya.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: sabilrilanenga walangai nai tarokoko si kaang mwdaane twaga asiyaete ki too.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: maolai nai kiya lalavalava si madralemedremenga.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: la ki’adrelre agili nakowa mawriva matikay, atwanaw kanai isasadra swa sivwtai, naw mwbaliyako lo elra taisadrasadraza.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: ko kaingoli mawriva amiyaikay twaganga ko taleke, mwa dawlo lrakay takane’a!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: la dawdawlo nai ki lraretesa si lratalagi, akela maelele mita akiso’ili kane kwaobo ka taleke.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: yakai yako tangea ka tabereli sya Kecelre, tara karimoro iloko ini lamanema.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kecelre，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kecelre, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: lo kibolobolo nai, kwani wakisalro latabere idra cingpi, samosakisakidra si ciywming.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: angivale, angi’osale, angitolrolo, akisalro iniya makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: amanisa, yakai ka malisi iyaiyaiya ini, tara wakisalro si kai sawli.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: sabilrilanenga kadro kiaomaw makanaelre akisalro iniya.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: yakai sa makavale,kota ka makanaelre maedede mwa kivaevang.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: ikai kaelrelrea yowata, Kecelre ai mwa laang,si karimoro iloko weysengce.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kecelre想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kecelre wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: la kwani wakisalro weysengce ki latabere, si konai ka makanaelre tobalre iniya amiyaikay, miyaliyako kadrowa iloko laiya.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: la kasasibolo tobitobi Kecelre, si kalisi mawriva amiyaikay ,asi kai akisalro weysengce nakowa makanaelre!
S.TRANSL: Kecelre急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Kecelre burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: lamani ko latabere elraelra iniya, asiloiya kaso ilokoiyasono, lo akisalro moswa lamanema, kadrwy sawli!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: lo azana, mwlalakese ko Kecelre asabale kelanga baolo, na sawli lamanema idra wakisalro ini ki latabere.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kecelre很早就到學校了，Kecelre把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kecelre arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: ’ayy amoliyaili laiya ko Kecelre ki latabere, wathingalenganako laiya si loiganenga ai angiyailokako ,si kiyaseaseng ki latabere owakaene akisalro iniya lamanema.
S.TRANSL: Kecelre向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Kecelre apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: ko tamali ka tara ana’ana yata ka cekele.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: sa lrolainganako, ko tamali si agiini wadavace lo amaong, wailoko dra labo bakalre si kwang.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: lo lredranga, lai wailoko lini swalro’o mobaliyo.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: yakailo baboy, yakailo ravare, nadroma miyakai sadamatha.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: kolini avalavalanga swalro’o ikai tamwadriadringa ki cekele, akiso’ili sakacekele.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: loiya makavalazako ki tamali, ai to’alra tamali alro’o.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: ko tamali mawriva amiyaikay, lo kadrawnga so naw iloko mosowa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: ko sawalai ki cekele yakailo arakai tokolro ’aana, wadare’elini thelrece si taene.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: ko tamali ka malrigili dare’e thelrece, si mawriva amiyaikay, kaivai ka sarakaiya wala sadamatha, ai caceela si kilralibaka nai idra taodra’ala ki waodriodri’i, ai drakale nai tokolro ikai talranelriniya.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: alrolrodo kalralekete kirarokodro to’alra ki lratamatama alro’o, tothadalanako kicakwa dare’e tokolro, ’adalo wa’ana tokolroli.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: la ceele ko tamali mawriva nakowa amiyaikay, lobibilrili ai mwelra tino tara ana’ana si malrigili so.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: kaiyasa madrawnganako,waelraiyako kwadra boo si lraylili,to’a’alra tamali alro’o.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: kainganai avalavala si akiso’ili swalro’o ki sakacekele.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: ko tamali elraelra amiyaikay, konai ai kiyaseasengta sa sobolobolo ki lratomoita, la ataromara makala ka swalro’o.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: kai miyalrealre abilrilinganako mwa twakesi.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: samwako ki tatakesikesiya, la karimorako iloko ina labaceli.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: la kainako wailoko sa manemanenga.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: sa takesikesinai, konako si sataberaneli la mokasanai ceele ki ’acase.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: sa sikingnai, kai sataberaneli la ’akisalro nakowa ’inpici si samosakisakidra.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: ko singsinai la iniya kawriva nakwa, “loelanga molalakesa angidrakale, kai abilribilrilinga !”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: ko talragili siya ’Alri, miya lalake ki Ngodradrekai.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Alri，他也是魯凱族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Alri, and he is also an Rukai child.

S.FORM: wamaelrelrenai ikai ki cekelenai Taromak twakesikesi.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在Taromak部落讀書。
We study together in the Taromak tribe.

S.FORM: tara maelrelrenai kilalalra ki tarwarodrang lo tomaowlawlay, miya malrigilinai sinTaromakakaana.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說東魯凱語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Rukai proficiently.

S.FORM: mabelrengako si kabitolro, ko ’Alri malebe si karilai.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Alri很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Alri is short and thin.

S.FORM: ko ’Alri wa’ararakenga, madalamenai makanaelre ki iniya.
S.TRANSL: Alri很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Alri is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Kaivaiyana ’ongdokai tatakesikesiya, makarakara makalra ikai tatakesikesiya.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: yakai ka mabilibilibili sakakereng, ti’iti’isi mali, lrabwale, malikasaw si lraylrayli.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: makarakara ako lrabwale.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: salrabwale ako, moarairay ako, acolro twaerairay sa makalra.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: amanisa angidrakale ako, twsatamiya a’otalicobong lrabwale.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: sa danolako kainganai kai laomase wakiaragai.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ene kadro ako amalra sa mwsakaeea, amanisa kiaragai ako, asilwiya danolako makarakara.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: koza konako si tamali amwanai lika’e agi tamali ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: madola dra’ale agi ki tamali ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kwani elaela naiya , daane calraviya matrabelrang eea ka barongolo
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: kwani sa ’odringadringi calraviya, twalai calravaya mocili mwdaedae.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: tamali wailoko bwate ki goong si sabiki baai ki agi ki tamali ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: konako si agi ki tamale ka sawaly ikai daane masosososo. Kawni akiso’ili sa makalra maolai
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: sa aikiovagaizako, agi tamali ka sawalay osamalra nakoa mabelengnga , si haro aniomasa miya.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: la kawrivako, “nama ai adravako dra’aleso modringainga, lo ela niyamanga naiyana kivaevang.”
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: 2022 ka cayli, sihe dawlo kaigi athorokai lakacalisiya nibongsiyo kalalekete teasikatha kacalisiyana wacase nagane ikai belenge.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: kielaela ako anisikalralenga kisana kecengana malra “teasikatha sinagane kwacalisiyana” yakai cekele ki mwkathabara ka Cegaw.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Cegaw。
I interviewed Noami Kulas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: konako si kwani makaketeketenai kikai niciyo mwaliniyana homong.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ikai tahomongnga. aiya nakoa elaela tatwalaza acoga ki naganeini. tako iloko nakwa athingale cekecekeleini, si cekeleini.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: la kielaela ako asorakedre aela ki nagane, malisi koani sw’ili ta’acasa?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: la kawriva nakwa, lo arakai lrawtiyatiya kadroi kalalekete mwa’ahoa ’elaela acoga ki nagane, kai droma ka omase arakai “Ce syngseng” la asolwkai kimacacava.
S.TRANSL: which resulted in many jokes being made.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him Na Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Cegaw la kawriva, “koacalisiyana wa’acase ’onagane atengatenga ahoa. naganeli ka daihiyo yanai swmanema kacalisiya, yanai ka cekecekele, yanai ka loloda, anatomasi arotakalra kai laretesa malra sawli naganelini.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Noami Kulas said, The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: koza konako si kaingo amwanai iciba taikaiya thakathakai, ko kaingo iloko sa makalra ’odrolini laceng mwa, watwairoa moadriadringai kacalisiya akanea baai ki laomase.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: madalame makanaelre taikaiya thakathakai ki kaingo, takalra ka omase walangai ki tavangolo si rasease, takalra ka omase kela ’alavalava againi airo’a.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: twairo’a maongo si tobinereberese moadringai aramoro, lamani niakama bwate ki baboy, tasabaliyana kiakadalame takalra ki bazabaza, kela makanaelre tilibi.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米非常好吃，還有烤山豬肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: lowagaga ko kaingo, yakayako thili aiaidi ki bazabaza. yakaiyako thili akwadraw tawtaw, “’odrolinai kaivai laceng kadroa ni’osababo, imiya loangai!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: akase mwlangai lamanemanenai lre’eng, ko kaingo amiyaikai, “yakaiso ’osakaelre kikai lakwani”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, It's all thanks to your help.""

S.FORM: kavai tamasikaikaita, kicakwako matikai ki kacalisiya racave si akanekanea kodra ki ligila, si kiabalra ako tikaiya thakathakai lamanema kiadolro aramoro.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: celeako ki kaingo madralame ki sinikadroma kanekaneta, konako ’acoco’o si maesai kiragai aramoro tamiyaneli.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
